title: Kike Maíllo
text:
Enrique "Kike" Maíllo Iznájar (; born 3 June 1975) is a Spanish film director and screenwriter. He is best known for "<a href="Eva%20%282011%20film%29">Eva</a>", which won him the 2011 <a href="Goya%20Award%20for%20Best%20New%20Director">Goya Award for Best New Director</a>.
Biography.
From 1994 Maíllo studies at the Escola Superior de Cinema i Audiovisuals de Catalunya (<a href="Cinema%20and%20Audiovisual%20School%20of%20Catalonia">ESCAC</a>). His degree project was the short film "Las cabras de Freud", with <a href="Trist%C3%A1n%20Ulloa">Tristán Ulloa</a> in the lead role. Since 2000 he teaches screenwriting and directing the ESCAC.
